business.name: Essex Damp Solutions
business.type: Damp proofing and property preservation specialist

rising_damp.description: Treatment for ground floor dampness caused by groundwater rising through walls due to failed or absent damp proof course
rising_damp.includes: DPC injection with BBA-approved products, salt-contaminated plaster removal, specialist replastering, 20-year guarantee

penetrating_damp.description: Repair of damp caused by water penetrating horizontally through walls, roofs, or around windows
penetrating_damp.causes: Damaged pointing, cracked render, faulty gutters, damaged roof tiles, porous brickwork

condensation.description: Solutions for moisture caused by poor ventilation and warm moist air meeting cold surfaces
condensation.solutions: Extractor fans, PIV systems, MVHR, ventilation improvements

basement_waterproofing.description: Waterproofing for below-ground spaces including cellars and basements
basement_waterproofing.methods: Cementitious tanking, cavity drain systems, sump pumps

damp_proof_course.description: Installation of new DPC via chemical injection or physical insertion

mould_removal.description: Professional mould treatment and prevention by addressing underlying moisture source
mould_removal.includes: Fungicidal treatment, root cause identification, prevention advice

damp_survey.description: Professional diagnosis using calibrated moisture meters and expert analysis
damp_survey.includes: Moisture readings, visual inspection, salt analysis, written report, treatment recommendations, fixed-price quote

quick_answers.how_to_identify_rising_damp: Tide marks up to 1m above floor level, white salt deposits (efflorescence), peeling wallpaper at skirting level, musty smell, ground floor only, doesn't improve with ventilation
quick_answers.how_to_identify_condensation: Water droplets on windows and cold walls, black mould in corners and behind furniture, worse in winter mornings, affects any floor, improves with ventilation
quick_answers.how_to_identify_penetrating_damp: Damp patches that get worse during/after rain, can appear at any height, often corresponds to external defects, no tide mark pattern
quick_answers.rising_vs_condensation: Rising damp: ground floor only, tide marks up to 1m, salt deposits, worse when evaporation is slow. Condensation: any floor, water droplets, black mould, cold surfaces, worse in winter, improves with ventilation
quick_answers.average_treatment_cost_rising_damp: £1,500-£4,500 for typical Essex terraced or semi-detached house including DPC injection and replastering
quick_answers.service_area: 15-mile radius from Seven Kings covering Ilford, Barking, Dagenham, Romford, Hornchurch, Upminster, Chadwell Heath, Goodmayes, Manor Park, East Ham and surrounding Essex areas
quick_answers.dpc_lifespan: 20+ years for properly installed chemical DPC with BBA-approved products
quick_answers.replastering_needed: Usually yes - salt-contaminated plaster must be removed and replaced with specialist renovating plaster for lasting results

local_expertise.common_issues: Many Victorian/Edwardian properties in Essex lack original damp proof courses or have failed slate/bitumen DPCs after 100+ years. Becontree Estate (1920s-30s) properties in Dagenham often have failing original DPCs.
local_expertise.local_factors: Essex clay soil, variable water table, older housing stock concentration in Ilford/Seven Kings/Barking, coastal proximity affects humidity levels

credentials.guarantees: 20-year insurance-backed guarantees on all DPC work
